instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message:
Passes all Apple diagnostic tests. Geniuses said its a faulty TouchBar
Tried most of these - [URL='https://repair.wiki/w/A1706_2016-2017_13%E2%80%9D_Touchbar_MacBook_Pro']https://repair.wiki/w/A1706_2016-2017_13‚Äù_Touchbar_MacBook_Pro[/URL]
[LIST]
[*]Disconnected the Touchbar as it was showing only yellowish background
[*]Wiped the drive and reinstalled High Sierra - It installed properly, but on the next restart this error comes again
[*]Boot in Safe mode and tried to update from there. Takes a very long time to load into. Even the screen refreshes on lines. On the next restart went to the same screen
[*]Disconnected LCD and tried on external to update, same error.
[*]No visible corrosion around  <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLEEP3_BUCK3</SIGNAL> = 1.79v
[/LIST]
Any other suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message:
"Tried most of these"
You didn't mention if tried known good touchbar.

Check all resistors around <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>/10.
<SIGNAL>PMU_TO_SOC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PMU_TO_SOC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  Goes 1.79V when it turns on

Tried another touchbar, stuck at the same message, however no light on the brand new and used touchbar with a case. Suspecting something touchbar related on the board?

Resistors seems fine. Slight oxidation around underfilled SSD chips shield and test points. But nothing major, cleaned still same. Loads under Linux and Windows with touchbar disconnected,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message: So you've tested its touchbar with other MLB?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message: dont have spare A1770 for test, but have spare palmrest with functioning touchbar, as well as brand new touchbars

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message:
Got a spare <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, placed this board into spare casing and same error message.
Placed working <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in this one's case and touchbar and everything else is working.

Any areas I should cross-compare measurements of while I have them both here? <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> is shielded but will take measurements of the surroundings

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message: You could try and reflow <CHIP>U4200</CHIP>. I've fixed a few of these just by doing that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message: [USER=7922]@tcampbell34[/USER] Have you come across a crashed software update issue? It must have overheated and cold jointed then. Thanks for this I will try.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message: Compare voltages on J4401/02 between both boards; touchbar connected, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full" alt="1651563669998.png"]60604[/ATTACH]

Managed to measure these, but cant the rest, impossible without ripping the trackpad cables. This board also doesnt turn on without a battery.

J4401 Diode mode reading between two boards are identical on J4401

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Critical Software Update failed to install
threads.message: You should search and find test points, or component terminals connected to the lines of the connector.
